scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal and professional papers of Elizabeth Lyons. The professional papers document her work for the U.S. Department of State, the Ford Foundation, the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology. There are also reference materials and manuscripts related to her research on Thai painting and on various other aspects of Southeast Asian arts and culture. Records related to her work for the State Department include correspondence and authorization forms. Records from the Ford Foundation include reference reports, proposals, and correspondence. Museum records include essays, correspondence, exhibit proposals, queries about museum objects, information on loans of objects. Personal papers include Lyons' memoirs, correspondence, journals, sketchbooks, literary and poetic manuscripts by Lyons, articles, school papers, clippings, invitations, ephemera, and some printed volumes. There are numerous letters from Lyons to her mother written while she was in Thailand. Most of the correspondence is incoming. Correspondents include Richard Lert and James H.W. Thompson. Other materials related to Jim Thompson include clippings, photographs, and information on his house in Thailand. The collection includes numerous photographs, negatives, and slides of Asian art as well as personal photographs.
